Eve Wakamiya, devoutly contemplating dry landscape gardens, perceiving harmony through tea and sword, adding to one more day of wit. The Nordic traditions of hunting and feasting, the Japanese customs of self-discipline and loyalty to the lord— which serves as bone or skin have long become empty words. Enjoying life, pursuing dreams, absorbing the essence, and miraculously avoiding the dross. Generous, straightforward, and willing to go through fire and water for others, this is you, forever holding onto your original faith.

Bushido!
The keyboardist of Pastel*Palettes, of Japanese-Finnish descent, Eve once lived in Finland for a long time. Before joining PasPale, she was a model.

She loves watching Japanese period dramas, which has led to a strong admiration for the spirit of Bushido, making "Bushido" her catchphrase; she also loves other aspects of Japanese culture, often using expressions like "can feel the heart of harmony/wabi-sabi/..." but occasionally misuses idioms, and has expressed that she "wants to become Yamato Eve" (Maya: ?).

Eve is always radiant and uplifting, facing all of life's challenges with a full-hearted attitude. She is easy-going and polite, loves hugging others, and genuinely loves all her friends (she couldn't possibly have any enemies).

Despite her activities with PasPale, Eve is also active in the Tea Ceremony Club, Flower Arrangement Club, and Kendo Club at Hanasakigawa. Upon entering her third year, she became the head of all three clubs simultaneously. Additionally, she works part-time as a waitress at Hazawa Coffee.
(Compiled from Fandom and Moegirlpedia)

Kendo is a Japanese fencing martial art. Participants wear protective gear, wield bamboo swords, are barefoot, and compete one-on-one on a fixed-size square wooden floor. They must strike the opponent's valid target areas according to the rules, and points and victory are determined by referees.

As described in the leader's civilopedia entry, Eve, who loves Bushido culture, serves as the president of the Hanasakigawa Kendo Club. She has personally demonstrated thrilling kendo matches to Reona Kudō.

Simo Häyhä, the "White Death," is perhaps one of the world's most famous snipers, with a record of 505 confirmed kills during the Winter War. His success also demonstrated the effectiveness of Finland's guerrilla warfare strategy.
